reasoning: Squamous cell carcinoma represents ~90% of oral cavity malignancies. Tongue is a major anatomical site within oral cavity cancer. Global oral cavity cancer incidence approximately 5-7 per 100k from GLOBOCAN; tongue SCC estimated as significant subset at ~2.1 per 100k. Confidence moderate due to limited availability of specific SCC-of-tongue epidemiological data separate from broader oral cavity cancer registries.
source: GLOBOCAN 2005 (IARC) - Oral cavity and pharyngeal cancer estimates; calculated subset for tongue SCC
